3.Name: Switch
3.Description:
Functions as a switch with <ChoiceNum> entries with a choice determined by (<Choice>)
<Switch>
3.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

uses SCPT Analyze to get a float back.
uses this as a parameter into 8025a1a4

8025a1a4:
  -If the value is between zero and 4.2949e9
    -If the value is greater than 2.14748e9
      -2.14748e9 is subtracted from the value
    -Then neg(int(value)) is returned

6.Name: Set Int
6.Description:
Puts <Value> as Int into location: *add[0x8030e3e4,*mul[<Offset>,4]*]* 

If <Offset> == 0, it corresponds to player gold
If <Offset> == 1, it corresponds to player reputation
6.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

It takes two parameters, however both parameters are also processed by SCPT:
The first one is used to determine a pointer to where a value should be written.
The second parameter is generated by SCPT to determine the value to write.

if the first value is 1, it sets the player reputation to the generated value and recalculates the swashbuckler rank

if the first value is 0, it bounds the player's gold (prevents it from being more than 99,999,999 or less than 0)

10.Name: Jump
10.Description:
Checks endian, masks to between -65536 - 65536 bytes.

Goto <Offset> bytes from here.
*lnk[Offset,<Offset>]*
10.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

Reads in the word at the current pointer position
if the word > 65536 or word < -65536:
	Reverse byte order

		(seems like this would be a thing if the Offset was put in in the wrong order. i.e. big endian vs. little endian.

Then, use the Offset and go to.

11.Name: Load Subscript
11.Description:
Load a subscript, while placing a return position in the subscript stack.

*lnk[Offset,<Offset>]*
11.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

Increments 8030e71a by 1
	This is the counter for the depth of the current substack

Adds a pointer to the current position to the subscript stack

Adds the Offset to the current instruction pointer to go to the subscript.

12.Name: Return
12.Description: Go up once on subscript stack. Exit script interpretation if no entries in subscript stack.
12.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

1) Checks whether there are any subscripts left on the stack
	if there are subscripts left, sets the pointer to the previous subscript and returns 0
2) Checks whether 8030ceaa is less than 2
	if so, sets 8030e714 to 0, returns 0

If none of the above, returns 1

It looks like this instruction is used during cutscenes to force a frame advance before performing the next cutscene.

15.Name: Force next frame
15.Description:
***Not used in the game***

This instruction will set the 0x4 field in the current instruction buffer to zero. This forces the instruction interpreter function to exit allow for the next frame to be drawn. On next frame, any pending instruction buffers will be read.
15.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

Sets a zero in the current workspace, then advances the pointer and returns. 

No parameters

16.Name: Sleep
16.Description:
Waits for <Duration> frames before continuing with the script.
This forces a frame refresh as the 0x4 field of the instruction buffer is set to zero
16.Notes:
Dependancy on param1
If param1 & 1 == 1
set timer based on result of scpt analyze in terms of frames
If param1 & 2 == 1
skip frames until the timer is resolved

In addition to animations, seems to be used for file loading as well.

17.Name: Set Bit
17.Description:
Sets a bit in the bit field at 0x80310b3c
Bit: *add[<Offset>,0]*
17.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

First, it checks that the next value is not 
7F7FFFFF. If it is, it moves the scpt pointer up two and sets uvar1 to be 0x7FFFFFFF

Otherwise, it enters scptAnalyze to generate uvar1

A byte Offset is generated from  the upper 15 bits of uvar1, while the bit to set is generated from masking uVar1 with 0x1f

18.Name: Unset Bit
18.Description:
Unsets a bit in the bit field at 0x80310b3c
Bit: *add[<Offset>,0]*

(Sets the bit to 0)
18.Notes:
No dependancy on param1
Functional at all times

First, it checks that the next value is not 
7F7FFFFF. If it is, it moves the scpt pointer up two and sets uvar1 to be 0x7FFFFFFF

Otherwise, it enters scptAnalyze to generate uvar1

A byte Offset is generated from  the upper 15 bits of uvar1, while the bit to unset is generated from masking uVar1 with 0x1f

	803473b0 => 0
	803473b4 => 1

803473b4 seems to be a flag which loads the save menu

259.Name: Hamachou Hermit Stat Dialog
259.Description:
Helper instruction for Hamachou Hermit. Displays a text box containing current stats of a certain type.

Dialog display index: <DISP_ID>

Battles - (0, 1, 10, 2)
Runs - (3, 4)
Knocked Unconscious - (5, 6)
Treasure Chests - (7, 8)
Fish - (9)

Technically, Domingo's discovery text can also be displayed using this instruction using 100 as the parameter.

261.Name: Domingo Discovery Dialog
261.Description: Instruction to display a textbox from Domingo with the current number of discoveries. Uses the same function as INST_259 but with a 100 as the parameter to force Domingo's text.

262.Name: Activate Screen Overlay
262.Description:
Fades out into a color as defined below:

Red (0-255): <Red>
Green (0-255): <Green>
Blue (0-255): <Blue>
Distance from Camera: <Distance>
Transition Time: <Transition Time>

Distance in direction camera is pointing is negative, and reverse is positive. Text boxes appear at -1, so distance should be less than -1 to show text boxes.
